title: 108_s199
content: The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include a section on Canadian transboundary movement of municipal solid waste. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include a section prohibiting the import, transport, or export of municipal solid waste for final disposal or incineration in violation of the Agreement with Canada. The Administrator is granted authority to enforce this prohibition. The Administrator is authorized to enforce the prohibition on importing, transporting, or exporting municipal solid waste for final disposal or incineration in violation of the Agreement with Canada. They must perform designated functions and implement the Agreement, giving weight to state and local government views on importation. The Administrator must consider local government views on importing municipal solid waste and assess the impact on recycling programs, landfill capacity, air emissions, road deterioration, and public health/environment. Compliance orders may be issued based on relevant information. The Administrator can issue civil penalties or bring civil actions against individuals violating the section. Orders may require immediate compliance or specify a deadline. The Administrator can issue orders for violations with specific penalties not exceeding $25,000 per day of noncompliance. Penalties consider the seriousness of the violation and any good faith efforts made. The Administrator can issue orders for violations with penalties up to $25,000 per day, considering the seriousness of the violation and any good faith efforts to comply. Requests for a public hearing must be submitted within 30 days of the order, leading to a prompt hearing conducted by the Administrator with the ability to issue subpoenas. The Administrator can issue orders for violations with penalties up to $25,000 per day. Requests for a public hearing must be submitted within 30 days, leading to a prompt hearing with the ability to issue subpoenas and assess civil penalties for noncompliance. Regulations are in place for witness testimony, document production, and discovery procedures. Sec. 4011 addresses Canadian transboundary movement of municipal solid waste.
